The Cambodia Voluntary National Review (CVNR) will be produced during four years by four reports;

  1. CVNR 2015-2018, published on June 2019
  2. CVNR 2019-2022, published on June 2023
  3. CVNR 2023-2026, published on June 2027
  4. CVNR 2027-2030, published on June 2030

The Royal Government of Cambodia (RGC) has robust and conducive policy and regulatory frameworks to ensure affordable access and connectivity. RGC, development partners, and private sector has continued to target infrastructure, essentially roads, rail, bridges, ports, hydropower, solar farms, power transmission lines and irrigation systems. This has, to some extent, enabled garment factories to be shifted from the capital to rural areas, making it closer to labour source and relieving some burdens on urban infrastructure.

The indicator aims to measure the percentage of trainee and student who have achieved the minimum learning outcomes in vocational education program.

Number of trainees, students enrolled in TVET, aged 15-24 yrs devided by Population aged (15-24 yrs and multiply with 100

Ministry of labor and Vocational Training & Ministry of Planning will validate the data

The Ministry of Planning has the statistic and report department to lead the data management, data assurance and data assessment from its own ministry and the Ministry of Labor and Vocational Training

The Ministry of labor and Vocational Training have the statistic and report department to lead the data assurance and data assessment from their own ministries

The Ministry of labor and Vocational Training have the statistic and report department to lead the data assurance, reporting format, reporting monitoring and quality checking before sending the report to The Ministry of Planning.

This indicator can be disaggregated by sex, occupation, age, region and others.
